DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Resolution Prior Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Onset Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether acute graft versus host disease (aGVHD) resolved prior to the onset of chronic graft versus host disease (cGVHD).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Resolution Prior Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Onset
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth; also, the size of the smallest element that can be separated from neighboring elements. The term is used in optics, to describe imaging systems, in genetics and molecular biology, to define the degree of molecular detail on a physical map of DNA, ranging from low to high._Earlier in time or order._A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._The start, beginning, or early stages. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Resolution
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth; also, the size of the smallest element that can be separated from neighboring elements. The term is used in optics, to describe imaging systems, in genetics and molecular biology, to define the degree of molecular detail on a physical map of DNA, ranging from low to high.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
Return to the normal structure and/or function, e.g. the subsidence of a pathologic process, as the subsidence of an inflammatory lesion or new growth.

Property.preferredName: Prior Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Onset
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:The start, beginning, or early stages. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
The start, beginning, or early stages.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes/ No/ Unknown/ Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Yes, no, unknown or not applicable responses to a question or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.origin: LCBCC:Lung Cancer Biomarkers and Chemoprevention Consortium

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
